sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: In eastern Ukraine, fierce fighting continues as Russia struggles to take the cities of Soledar and Bakhmut.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Voters in the Czech Republic head to the polls to choose their next president, but observers say it's too close to call.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: European Parliament Vice President Roberta Metzler tells Euronews that all MEPs must be accountable following the Qatar Gate corruption scandal.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Ukrainian soldier Vladimir Kerber died in Solidar and was laid to rest in Bucha.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: His life and death linked to two of the bloodiest scenes since the Russian invasion of Ukraine began. He was 46 years old and served 25 years as a policeman before voluntarily enlisting when the war began. Weeks later the streets of Bucha were littered with civilian corpses. In nearby Salida, a handful of Vladimir's comrades hold out as best they can against an onslaught by the Russian army and Wagner mercenaries.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Moscow says the city has fallen, Ukraine denies the claim.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Satellite images show the destruction compared to those of the same place that were taken months ago.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The Ukrainian president promises to do everything possible to prevent Salida and the neighboring Bakhmut from falling into the hands of an enemy that seems ready to take the cities at any price.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: While both armies continue to take casualties, civilians continue to suffer the consequences of the war.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Streets are almost empty, but underground there are many families, mostly elderly people, who refuse to leave their homes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Germany is to send around 40 Marder infantry fighting vehicles to Ukraine before the end of March.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The move represents a major step up in Berlin's military support for Kyiv, although it still falls short of the frontline battle tanks that Ukraine has been asking for.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: However, Poland says it will provide such tanks in the form of the Leopard 2, which is still made in Germany.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: We are now adapting to this change situation by delivering Marder tanks, and I believe that this is the right approach, not to rule anything out, but always to weigh up what I want to achieve, what are the challenges, and always to keep an eye on coordination with international partners, with our allies."

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Poland's President Andrzej Duda confirmed Warsaw's planned delivery of tanks after a meeting with Ukraine's president in Lviv.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: He said the move would be part of an international coalition.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Germany has made clear its support for Ukraine, both on a humanitarian and military basis, although any transfer of armaments from German production to third parties must be approved by Berlin. Voters in the Czech Republic head to the polls today and tomorrow to choose their next president.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Residents who are being forced to isolate due to COVID-19 can cast their vote at drive-in polling stations like these.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Three challengers appear to be in serious contention of victory, including former Prime Minister Andrej Babiša.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Retired army chief Petro Pavla and former university head Donujsi Neradova are also in the running.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: They will be hoping to galvanize the centrist voters who ousted Babiša at the last general election in 2021.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Observers say it's highly unlikely that any candidate will secure over 50% of the vote in the first round, meaning that a second round between the two top candidates is expected later this month.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: is expected later this month.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The European Parliament has come up with a new set of anti-corruption and transparency measures following the alleged cash-for-favor scandal.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: According to the President of the Parliament, Roberto Mazzola, who spoke to Euronews, the aim is to make everyone accountable in the institution.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: At the end of the day, trust that takes 20 years to build is destroyed within minutes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: So now we are embarking on a quick, speedy set of measures, some of which need to be reinforced, some of which could have been better reinforced, and some of which need to be introduced.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: In essence, reintroduce the concept of accountability, integrity and independence. We can be proud of our work, but we can do better.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Do you think this network had the chance to influence actual decisions here?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: We're looking into everything. We're looking into trips that have been approved, we're looking into trips that were not declared, we're looking at the process of putting forward amendments, timelines, the way resolutions are negotiated.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: What I want to make sure is that spheres of influence, at least the alarm bells should start to ring earlier. That's why we need to regulate access better, we need to regulate the transparency register better, but we also need to be also aware ourselves, and this I will tell all the members to be aware, and the staff members, if they see something that is not right, something has to be said and something has to be done.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: And will there be also legal protection for whistleblowers in this house?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: We can always improve on whistleblower protection.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: I said this not just as a politician, but also as a lawyer in order to protect this house but its members that once they see wrongdoing they can safely report it and be protected throughout the whole process. I need to be the guarantor of that and I will make sure of it. Do you think that new names will pop up in the scandal from the European Parliament, be it assistants or MEPs?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: That is not something that I can speculate on at this point in time.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Whether there will be more, I can only reassure your viewers and our citizens that I will respond with the most correct and immediate manner possible.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Some political parties and some governments are already portraying the European Parliament as a corrupt institution and they are saying that we don't take any lessons on rule of law and on corruption from the Parliament.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: What do you respond to this sort of criticism?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: I think there will always be forces in Europe that will try to destroy the European Union, the European Parliament, which is a house of openness, transparency, loud voice in defense of democracy, human rights and rule of law.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: My answer to that is precisely the measures that I have been given the full mandate today by all political groups from left to right in the Parliament to work on.

sentences.sentence: Just nine years old when her famous father died in 1977, she followed in his footsteps as a singer and actor.
